p: CsA is a ligand that can bind to CyPA. Upon binding, the molecular structure of CsA changes significantly compared with its unbound structure. The original hydrogen bonds in the molecules are broken, and a new hydrogen bond is formed [ 30]. In addition, proline-containing peptides are converted from cis to trans, so that the resulting compound can be combined with CaN, while neither CsA nor CyPA alone can bind to CaN. CsA, with a molecular size of 11 amino acid cyclopeptides, has a surface bound to CyPA's PPIase trench, as well as a surface that can bond with CaN [30] ( Fig. 1).
